name: Fairmont Pacific Rim

reviews.text: Our room was fantastic, interactive & automated, so 21st Century. Beautiful view of both water, cruise ships & cityscape. Nespresso maker in room & easy access to internet (free if you're a member of the Fairmont President's Club). Lovely bathroom, deep soaking tub and excellent product. The room itself is really nice, well appointed, comfortable and easy to run with the in room automated system....which works for everything.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, warm staff and lovely views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed drinks in the lounge, really nice place to sit , talk and listen to some music....fabulous!
reviews.title: Best Hotel of the Trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is so genuine and nice. The house car took us to Robson Street, came back and picked us up 20 minutes later.....how nice is that.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We spend a lot of time in Vancouver and this is now our hotel of choice. Can't wait to return!
reviews.title: Amazing room sizes

reviews.text: Our stay at the Pacific Rim was one of the best hotel stays I have had in a while! I had the option of using a suite or room upgrade. I choose the room upgrade as I didn't see a need for the huge suite and absolutely loved the room!
reviews.title: It feels like being in a dream, so welcoming and relaxing.

reviews.text: We had an outstanding stay at the Fairmont Pacific Rim in Vancouver. They upgraded us to a corner suite which had beautiful views on the city and harbor. The suite was as nice as any we have ever stayed in and the services, food and location were excellent throughout our stay. We highly recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arriving into Vancouver, we were greeted by the wonderful team at the Fairmont Pacific Rim. Once our check-in was completed by the lovely young ladies on reception, we where accompanied up to our room with a concierge team member, who ensured that we were settled and totally informed of ALL the facilities available to us in the room. We were even supplied an I Pad for personal use whilst at the hotel. Staff, comfort and cleanliness not to mention the location ensured we had made a wonderful choice. Our initial stay was for 4 nights (ie 8 May 2013 - 12 May 2013)in a city view room and a second stay (16 May to 18 May 2013), this time the hotel placed us in a waterfront view room. How breathtaking it was. Thank you Fairmont Pacific Rim, you have ensured that our stays will remain memorable. Right down to the turning down of the bed with the slippers on stand-by. TV's in the bathroom mirror, this was a brilliant new innovation for us. When back in Vancouver we will not hesitate to book back into your hotel.
reviews.title: Canadian Candy
The Fairmont Pacific Rim in Vancouver is excellent
reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel, our stay was very pleasant. Can you imagine a terrace with a fireplace?
We had rain everyday, it was only the excellent room that helped making our days nice and warm
reviews.title: Outstanding!!

reviews.text: Besides, the location is excellent, my medical meeting was just across the street.
reviews.title: Stay here, you will not be sorry

reviews.text: Stayed in the Fairmont Pacific Rim for 3 nights in October 2013. Despite the fact that a certain Canadian born Hollywood celebrity recently died in the hotel, I was looking forward to my first time stay there.
reviews.title: Excellent, modern and efficiently run upper end hotel in the heart of downtown Vancouver.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, the location. Very well located and within easy walking distance to the waterfront train station and the surroundings look very clean and safe.
reviews.title: Fantasic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was super efficient. They even hand you your hotel room keys at the bell desk and hence you can avoid the need to queue at the reception desk. Almost everything in the room is high-tech and paperless with controls and requests done via an iPad. Ingenious! I was impressed!
reviews.title: Almost perfect

reviews.text: Housekeeping was excellent and responsive. No complaints there.
reviews.title: Disappointed
Great stay, can't say enough
reviews.text: I stayed on the Fairmont Gold Floor so could consume my daily breakfast in the club lounge. Unfortunately the choice of food for breakfast was very limited and after 2 days, I was thoroughly bored! The evening canapés was better and the wine selection was impressive.

reviews.title: Gorgeous, modern, but expensive!
reviews.text: Stayed here on business - gorgeous hotel, very sophisticated and modern. Right downtown near all attractions. You can see the water and mountains from your room. Lobby is absolutely stunning.
I was in an upgraded room, and the washroom was the largest bathroom I have ever seen, complete with walk in tub, tv, etc. was stunning
reviews.title: Ensure you get the right room

reviews.text: The price was pretty steep, but it is Vancouver, and you get what you pay for. I would definitely stay here agin.
reviews.title: Terrible experience, would not stay again

reviews.text: Stayed for a business conference October 2013; upon arrival the staff were as suggested in previous gust posts; simply fantastic. I don’t know whether its a Canadian trait or just good training; but the staff at the Pacific Rim couldn’t be more attentive. As the hotel was full due to the size of our convention, obviously there were a large number of delegates trying to book in; this didn’t faze the staff; they just completed the registration speedily, with an understanding of our tiredness due to various long journeys.
reviews.title: Incredible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once I got to my room, my key card said I had a suite; my colleagues indeed did have a suite; my room certainly wasn’t; it had all the wiz bangs, ipad to run room facilities, TV in the bathroom mirror; large HD TV etc, but the room was small; why was i still paying for a suite?? And that wasn’t cheap! I have no issue with being told all suites had been taken, providing my room rate reflected my downgrading. The room was very comfortable, quiet with a pleasant view.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in a beautiful city....

description: With unobstructed views of the harbour and mountains, Fairmont Pacific Rim is a newcomer to an area rich in history and intrigue. Located in the heart of the historic port and financial district, the hotel fronts one of Vancouver’s most celebrated streetscapes with unobstructed views of the North Shore Mountains, Stanley Park and Coal Harbour. Sophisticated and cosmopolitan but casual and contemporary, this downtown Vancouver hotel combines the best of Asia and the west coast in its plan, décor, and culinary offerings. Designed with five star standards and amenities, the 377-room luxury Vancouver hotel features lavish appointments, naturally inspired materials, comfortable furnishings and state-of-the-art technology.
